Articles.Content: Is there a way to detach its focus from the absolute center of your craft? A TRUE free camera? Im trying to get an over the shoulder shot of my kerbal watching his planet drift away and im finding it quite impossible.
middle mouse button, it still follows your craft but not in the center.

There's a mod, I forget the exact name, Kerbal Cam or something like that. It's actually used to setup key points so you can do cinematic type camera movements, but I've used it for doing panoramas a few times. I'd imagine you could use it to do what you want as well, if the middle click doesnt do the trick.
The middle button doesn't have enough travel. Its terrible for larger craft. Does the mod work for .20?
Middle mouse button (usually the scroll wheel button) will unlock the camera from your ship's center of mass.

The middle button doesn't have enough travel. Its terrible for larger craft. Does the mod work for .20?

I've used it in .20 and it seems to work fine for me. Takes some getting use to though, still trying to get the hang of it, but I don't use it often, yet anyway.
so the camera can follow different points of the ship but still not completely free floating? very interested in a stationary camera for ship fly-bys and good views of kerbal faces
What if you dont have a middle mouse button? like on a laptop Is it in the control settings somewhere? I dont have the game running atm
